plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer‚Äôs name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic üòâ)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix ‚Äúexclude-‚Äù to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


üñ§ Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


üí¨ Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I‚Äôd love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
üëã Hi! 
I‚Äôm a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.tagline: JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into JSON data.

plugins.name: Jexity Tokens Exporter
plugins.description:
Jexity Tokens Exporter ables you to export variable collections and gradient styles into TailwindCSS configuration. This is to be used for TailwindCSS plugin.


For now, this can only be used for number and color variable types and for gradient styles. The plugin follows a specific structure and naming conventions, all of which are documented in the README.md file.
plugins.tagline: This ables you to export variable collections and gradient styles into TailwindCSS configuration.

plugins.name: bb-extract
plugins.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! üí´

93017.name: bb-extract
93017.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
93017.release_notes: Introduced a recursive check for local variables that reference other local variables, ensuring accurate calculation of values. This update resolves issues in previous versions where the target variable was located within a group inside a collection.
93017.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! üí´

* ‚úÖ Export JSON by collection

* ‚úÖ 100% compatible with Style Dictionary Configurator

* ‚úÖ Live search within JSON content

* ‚úÖ One-click copy or download as .json

* ‚úÖ Pagination for large data

plugins.name: Syntax Highlighter
plugins.description:
How to use


Applying syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a code snippet.
  2. Choose a programming language, if required (the plugin will try to identify the language automatically).
  3. Choose a theme.
  4. Toggle include background and line numbers, if required.
  5. Click Apply.


Clearing syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a formatted code snippet.
  2. Click the Clear formatting button.


Adding custom Visual Studio themes


  1. Open Visual Studio Code.
  2. Install the desired color theme and switch to the theme in Visual Studio Code.
  3. Press Ctrl + Shift + P and run Developer: Generate Color Theme from current settings.
  4. Select the file's contents and copy.
  5. Open the Figma plugin and press the Create a new theme button.
  6. Paste into the Create a new theme dialog and click Save.


Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.

accepted.name: Microsoft
accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

plugins.tagline: Apply syntax highlighting colors to code snippets.

Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.
134926.tagline: Apply syntax highlighting colors to code snippets.

plugins.name: Heurator
plugins.description:
Elevate your design critique process with Heurator, a powerful Figma plugin that brings Nielsen's 10 Usability Heuristics directly into your workflow.


Document, visualize, and solve usability issues with precision‚Äîall without leaving your design files.


‚úì Pinpoint violations with customizable severity ratings

‚úì Generate visually striking evaluation cards linked to problem areas

‚úì Create actionable recommendations to improve user experience

‚úì Maintain consistent evaluation criteria across your team


Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interface‚Äîwhether human or AI-designed‚Äîensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.
plugins.tagline: Because Even AI-Generated UIs Need Human-Centered Evaluation

Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interface‚Äîwhether human or AI-designed‚Äîensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.
131446.tagline: Because Even AI-Generated UIs Need Human-Centered Evaluation

plugins.name: Latin ‚áÑ Cyrillic
plugins.description:
Instantly flip any text layer‚Äîor whole frames‚Äîfrom Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.


üõ† How it works

‚Ä¢ Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

‚Ä¢ Run Plugins ‚Üí ‚ÄúLatin ‚ûú Cyrillic‚Äù or ‚ÄúCyrillic ‚ûú Latin‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Fonts auto‚Äëload, characters swap, you‚Äôre done


‚ú® Why it‚Äôs handy

‚Ä¢ Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

‚Ä¢ Handles digraphs (d≈æ, lj, nj, dj) correctly

‚Ä¢ Works inside components, variants, and instances

‚Ä¢ Zero setup, zero UI‚Äîpure speed


‚ö†Ô∏è Limitations

‚Ä¢ Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

‚Ä¢ Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops
plugins.tagline: One‚Äëclick Serbian Latin ‚áÑ Cyrillic transliteration

plugins.name: Smart Frame Organizer
plugins.description:
Smart Frame Tools helps you organize, duplicate, align, and rename frames in seconds ‚Äî no dragging, no chaos.


Designed for precision layouts, this plugin includes smart features to:


Automatically rename frames left-to-right, top-to-bottom


Align selected frames into clean grids


Enforce consistent horizontal spacing


Duplicate and insert frames intelligently with automatic renaming


Perfect for UI designers, developers, and anyone working with structured layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Smart Frame Tools ‚Äî Precision layout. Effortless control.

plugins.name: OS converter
plugins.description:
Stop duplicating your work! Convert entire flows or single frames between iOS and Android in seconds ‚Äî no more tedious manual adjustments.


Why OS Converter?

Designers are often faced with a choice:

  1. Design in one OS and leave conversions to developers
  2. Manually recreate each flow for both platforms


With OS Converter, you get the best of both worlds ‚Äî fast, accurate, and hassle-free conversion.


How it works:

  1. Set up your components ‚Äì Use a variant property named "OS" with values "iOS" and "Android"
  2. Run the plugin ‚Äì When your layouts are ready to convert
  3. Click to swap! ‚Äì Convert single frames or entire flows in one click
  4. üé® See it in action! Check out the sample file below.
plugins.tagline: Swap single frames or entire flows between iOS and Android in seconds!

plugins.name: Pattern Blocks
plugins.description:
Unlock unlimited pattern creation with Patternblocks!


With access to hundreds of unique shapes, you can create an endless variety of patterns tailored to your needs. Easily control tiling and pattern variety to achieve the perfect design, whether you're creating backgrounds, UI elements, or other graphic assets.


Customize colors and shape selections to match your vision, and export your patterns in high-quality PNG or SVG vector formats for use in web, app, and product designs.
plugins.tagline: Create endless unique vector patterns with hundreds of shapes for web, app, and product UI designs.

plugins.name: Case Shifter
plugins.description:
Overview

Streamline your design workflow with the Frame Renamer plugin for Figma! This tool allows you to quickly and efficiently rename frame names, making it especially useful when organizing and exporting layers.


Features

  1. Quick Rename: Easily rename frames in bulk, saving time and effort.
  2. Organize Layers: Keep your Figma projects neat and well-organized by using consistent naming conventions.
  3. Efficient Exporting: Simplify your exporting process by standardizing layer names, reducing errors and improving efficiency.


Supported Naming Conventions

The Frame Renamer currently supports the following cases:

  1. camelCase: e.g., frameNameExample
  2. snake_case: e.g., frame_name_example
  3. kebab-case: e.g., frame-name-example
  4. PascalCase: e.g., FrameNameExample


Future Updates

We are continually working to improve the Frame Renamer plugin. Stay tuned for more features and naming conventions in future updates!
plugins.tagline: Transform your Layer name, one case at a time.

plugins.name: Real Content Filler
plugins.description:
Real Data Filler is a quick and smart plugin that populates your Figma text layers with realistic placeholder data ‚Äî perfect for mockups, UI design, and prototypes.


Choose from a clean, tabbed interface with options like:


Names (full names, first/last)


Emails (realistic domains)


Cities (worldwide)


Phone Numbers


Custom Lists (coming soon)


Each selected text node gets a random data value of the type you select.


Use this to:


Populate wireframes with real-seeming names and emails


Fill mobile/table UI designs with user data


Quickly visualize form states and list views

accepted.name: Open Wave.io
accepted.description: Open Wave is an open-source organization Founded by Lawrence Okosa III. creating tools that streamline design and development workflows.

plugins.tagline: Fill selected text layers with real-looking names, emails, cities, and more

plugins.name: BlendAI
plugins.description:
BlendAI seamlessly integrates with Figma to let you generate high-quality images from text prompts or combine up to three reference images in a single click. It‚Äôs perfect for product mockups, hero banners, packshots, concept art, backgrounds, or quick visual inspiration‚Äîwithout ever leaving your Figma file.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Simple prompt ‚Üí image

Type a natural-language description and instantly receive a crisp, AI-rendered result.

‚Ä¢ Multi-reference blending

Upload up to three reference images (for example: a product shot, a texture, and a background) and instruct BlendAI to place, style, or combine them.

Example: ‚ÄúPlace @IMG_1 in front of @IMG_2 with the lighting mood of @IMG_3.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Six aspect-ratio presets

1:1 (Square), 16:9 (Landscape), 9:16 (Portrait), 4:3 (Classic), 3:4 (Portrait), 21:9 (Ultrawide)

‚Ä¢ Instant one-click generation

No manual exports or workarounds‚Äîeverything happens directly in Figma‚Äôs interface.

‚Ä¢ Credit-based system

Includes a free 10-image starter pack. Easily top up credits from the ‚ÄúGet More‚Äù menu.

‚Ä¢ History & quick re-use

View, revisit, and re-generate past images directly within the plugin.


BlendAI was built for designers who need on-the-fly visuals‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a quick hero image for a mockup, a polished packshot for a product page, or a fully blended scene combining multiple photo references. Try it free, then unlock larger credit packs for heavy usage.
plugins.tagline: AI image generation & multi-reference blending inside Figma for hero banners, mockups or backgrounds

plugins.name: Layer Organizer
plugins.description:
Layer Organizer

Is your Figma file a mess? Layers all over the place? Layer Organizer instantly organizes, groups, and aligns your selected layers ‚Äî with real-time visual feedback.


üöÄ Core Features:

  1. Auto Layer Organization: Instantly arranges and aligns selected layers for a clean, structured layout.
  2. Group Level Selection (1‚Äì5): Groups layers based on / in their names (e.g., Button/Primary), supporting deep hierarchies.
  3. Horizontal & Vertical Spacing: Set precise spacing between groups and layers. Quick presets: 200px, 400px, 1000px.
  4. Combine Single Layers: Merge single-layer groups into one clean ‚ÄúUngrouped‚Äù group. Toggleable.


üëÄ Preview & Visualization:

  1. Real-Time Preview: See changes instantly as you organize.
  2. Group View: Visual list of group names and included layers, with type labels (Frame, Component, Vector, etc.).


‚öôÔ∏è Settings & Shortcuts:

  1. Preference Memory: Automatically remembers your last settings for a smoother workflow.
  2. Default Values: Horizontal/Vertical spacing: 100px, Group level: 1, Combine single-layer groups: On.


‚ö° Performance-First Architecture:

  1. Two-Stage Processing: Measures first, positions after ‚Äî for faster, more accurate results.
  2. Safe Layer Sorting: Uses a temporary frame to reorder layers while preserving hierarchy and structure.


Organize! Preview! Perfect! üßº
plugins.tagline: Auto-arrange and group layers for a cleaner, more organized Figma canvas. üßº

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
üß© Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes ‚Äî including all their children ‚Äî with just a click.


‚ú® Features


- üîç Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- üßæ Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ‚úÖ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- üå≥ Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- üíæ Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ‚ö°Ô∏è Fast, no setup, no code required


---


üöÄ How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click ‚Üí Plugins ‚Üí Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `‚ú® Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `üîß Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


üì¶ Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


üîê Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


üß† Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


üë®‚Äçüíª Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children ‚Äî quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
plugins.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

138970.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
138970.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
138970.release_notes: The preview feature has been improved to allow users to review the extracted styles and color results directly in the plugin popup.
138970.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes ‚Äì done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

130750.name: Syntax Manager
130750.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.

  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform

  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes ‚Äì done!
130750.release_notes:
New Features:
- Inline syntax editing ‚Äì Click directly on syntax values to edit them instantly.
- Prefix dropdown ‚Äì Choose how templates are applied: Auto, Name, or Syntax mode.
- Multiple replacements ‚Äì Use ; to apply several find/replace patterns in one step.

Enhancements:
- UI improvements for better clarity and usability
- Various bug fixes for a smoother, more reliable experience
130750.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: Move to Origin
plugins.description:
Move to Origin is a simple utility plugin that positions your selected elements so that the topmost and leftmost element sits precisely at coordinates (0,0).


Instructions

1. Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas

2. Run the "Move to Origin" plugin from the Plugins menu

3. Your selection will instantly move so the topmost-leftmost element is at (0,0)


Key features:

  1. One-click positioning to origin point (0,0)
  2. Maintains relative spacing between all selected elements
  3. Works with any number of selected objects
  4. No UI ‚Äî just select and run


Perfect for:

  1. Cleaning up artboard layouts
  2. Preparing elements for export
  3. Standardizing component positions
  4. Aligning multiple elements to a predictable starting point


Simply select the elements you want to reposition, run the plugin, and watch as your selection snaps to the origin while preserving the spatial relationships between all elements.


Save time and maintain precision in your designs with this essential positioning tool.
plugins.tagline: Instantly align your selection to (0,0) while preserving relative positions between elements.

plugins.name: PureImage Export
plugins.description:
PureImage Export saves you the hassle of removing Corner radius and Effects when exporting images in Figma. With this plugin, you can easily export optimized images without the need for manual adjustments.


PureImage Export Features

üßπ Remove Corner Radius & Effects

üîç Preview Display

üìÅ Bulk Download Multiple Layers


How to Use:

  1. Select the layer with a Corner radius or Effects applied.
  2. Set up the export (default settings work fine too).
  3. Execute the PureImage Export.
  4. Set the Corner radius/Effects and click [Export as [file format]].


Recommended For:

  1. Anyone who needs to export optimized images from Figma for web development.
  2. Web designers and frontend developers who want to easily export and import images from Figma.
plugins.tagline: Export optimized images from Figma without removing corner radius or effects!

125876.description:

plugins.name: ARBFromDesign
plugins.description: Streamline your localization workflow with the ARBFromDesign plugin for Figma. This tool automatically extracts text from your Figma frames and generates ARB (Application Resource Bundle) entries in camelCase format, ready for translation. The plugin intelligently excludes date and time formats, ensuring clean and accurate entries. With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Generate ARB Entries from Your Figma Designs

108296.name: ARBFromDesign

With a simple click, you can export your design text to ARB files, speeding up your localization process and making your designs truly global.
108296.tagline: Effortlessly Generate ARB Entries from Your Figma Designs

plugins.name: Coop Rule Checker
plugins.description: This plugin provides you with a rule checker and utilities to support to design according to the Coop Group (Switzerland) CMS rules.

accepted.name: Coop-Gruppe
accepted.description:
We're from Switzerland, a large retail and wholesale cooperative society operating worldwide.
We provide food, non-food & services.
We have over 90000 employes.

plugins.tagline: A rule checker + utilities to support to design according to the Coop Group (Switzerland) CMS rules.

plugins.name: Quick Variant
plugins.description:
Allows designers to quickly cycle through component variants for selected instances. With simple commands, you can switch to the next or previous variant of a component, streamlining your design workflow.


Key features


  1. Rapidly explore different component states without manual swapping
  2. Efficiently test various design options in context
  3. Seamlessly navigate complex component sets
  4. Boost productivity when working with design systems


Perfect for designers who frequently work with component variants and want to speed up their iteration process.
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to swap variants of components

124663.name: Quick Variant
124663.description:

124663.release_notes: New commands available: Next/Previous Property and Next/Previous Value
124663.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to swap variants of components

plugins.name: Filler
plugins.description:
A simple data safe lorem ipsum generator, that let's you be specific about the type and length of content to add.


How to use


Launch the plugin with the full ui, or keep it as a quick action from the command panel, either way goes. Enter the amount of sentences words or paragraphs to insert and hit enter!


From yours truly,

Ryan Nono
plugins.tagline: A data safe lorem ipsum generator that works with tabbing and arrow keys for boosted productivity

plugins.name: Batch Color Labeler
plugins.description: This plugin automatically detects solid fill colors in selected shapes and labels them with unique, descriptive color names, hex codes, and RGB values. Great for style guides and color audits!

plugins.name: CopyPaste Styles for FigJam
plugins.description:
Instantly copy visual styles (fill, stroke, radius, font, text size, alignment) from one object and apply them to others in FigJam.

Supports shapes, stickies, and text blocks.

Works like Cmd+Alt+C / Cmd+Alt+V in Figma ‚Äî but for FigJam. Saves time and keeps formatting consistent across your boards.
plugins.tagline: Copy and paste visual styles between shapes, stickies, and text blocks in FigJam.

plugins.name: CapitalizeText
plugins.description: CapitalizeText is a sleek and powerful Figma plugin designed to simplify your text editing workflow. With just a click, convert selected text layers to uppercase or lowercase, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs. Featuring a modern, intuitive interface with vibrant visuals, CapitalizeText makes text transformation seamless and enjoyable. Perfect for designers who value efficiency and precision. Try it now and elevate your Figma experience
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Transform Text Case in Figma
